Stop-loss strategy: Triggering a sell order when the stock price falls by 15% from the current price or when the DBR (debt-to-asset ratio) exceeds 40%.
Stop loss at 20% below current price, sell when EPS growth slows down or ROE/ROA decreases significantly.
[Sell when the stock price falls by 15% from the current price or when the ROE and ROA turn negative]
Sell when the stock price falls by 15% from the current price or when the EPS decreases by 20% compared to the previous year.
